item.title: Is SpiceJet barred from flying over Bangladesh skies?
item.description: The Civil Aviation Authority of Bangladesh (CAAB) has refuted reports in the Indian media that SpiceJet has been barred from entering the country’s airspace over unpaid dues. Several Indian outlets, citing news agency PTI, reported that Bangladesh was not “allowing” the Indian ai

item.title: Inmate dies after falling ill at Dhaka Central Jail
item.description: An inmate at Dhaka Central Jail died after falling ill, officials said on Thursday. The deceased was identified as Abdul Khaleque, 65, son of the late Kafil Uddin. Prison guard Abdullah said Khalek fell ill inside the jail. On the instructions of the authorities, he was taken to Dhaka Medical Co

item.title: Two jailed as authorities seize 400kg of horse meat in Sirajganj
item.description: Authorities have seized around 400kg of horse meat in Sirajganj’s Kazipur Upazila and jailed two men for attempting to smuggle it for sale. The drive was carried out on Friday morning in the Meghai jetty area along the Jamuna River, said Kazipur Upazila administrator (UNO) Mustafizur Rahman.

item.title: Bangladesh lifts suspension of visa services in Delhi: report
item.description: Bangladesh has resumed visa services for Indian citizens at its High Commission in New Delhi around two months after they were suspended, Indian media report. The services were restored on Friday morning, according to India Today. The development comes three days after the BNP-led government took

item.title: Kremlin says it can't say yet when new talks on Ukraine will take place
item.description: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday that he cannot yet confirm when and where a new round of talks on Ukraine will take place. Earlier on Friday, Russian state news agency TASS reported, citing a source, that next talks would be held in Geneva with the participation of delegations from

item.title: Injured tigress likely to return to Sundarbans in March
item.description: The tigress that was rescued after being trapped and seriously injured is expected to be released back into her natural habitat in the Sundarbans as early as March, officials said. The animal has shown significant recovery after receiving about 45 days of treatment at the rescue centre in Khulna C

item.title: Temperatures rising, but no relief from rain yet
item.description: Temperatures are rising across Bangladesh, with the Met Office saying there is little prospect of rain in the coming days. “We had indicated earlier that temperatures would rise after the 15th of February. This trend is expected to continue over the next few days,” Meteorologist Kazi J

item.title: Man stabbed to death in Jashore
item.description: A village doctor was stabbed to death by miscreants in Sharsha upazila of Jashore while returning home after offering prayers on Thursday night. The incident took place around 9:30 pm at Baripota village in Sharsha upazila. The deceased was identified as Al Amin, son of Rafiqul Islam of the Shars

item.title: US tariff revenue at risk in Supreme Court ruling tops $175 billion, Penn-Wharton estimates
item.description: More than $175 billion in US tariff collections are at risk of having to be refunded if the US Supreme Court rules against President Donald Trump’s broad emergency tariffs, Penn-Wharton Budget Model economists said on Friday. Their estimate, produced at a request from Reuters, was derived fr

item.title: Amar Ekushey: Nation to pay tribute to language martyrs at zero hour
item.description: The nation is set to observe ‘Amar Ekushey’, the Language Martyr’s Day and the International Mother Language Day early Saturday, marking the supreme sacrifice of the language heroes for upholding the dignity of the mother tongue, Bangla. The day will also be observed around the w

item.title: President for being more mindful in preserving quality, dignity of Bangla
item.description: President Mohammed Shahabuddin urged all the Bangla-speaking people to be ever more mindful in its proper practice and in preserving its quality and dignity. “Language is the foremost custodian and carrier of a nation’s existence, heritage, and culture . . . As Bangla was earned throug

item.title: Jamaat chief to visit Shaheed Minar for the first time
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief and Leader of the Opposition Shafiqur Rahman has announced his plan to visit the Central Shaheed Minar on International Mother Language Day, marking a first for the party chief. While the party's student front Bangladesh Islami Chhatra Shibir has traditionally held rallies an
